record.text: What's odd, and annoying, is that this happens far more on Bluesky than on other platforms.
And some of them are actually real people!
I've been using, and touting, deck.blue all along. It's quite good but not as functional as X-Pro.
Thanks, hope you all had a good time!
Where is this?
Isn't Facebook, if you post only to your friends, who have mutually agreed to be friends, and not to the general public, a kind of closed user group?
Sure, ignorance is bliss, but it's also how Trump regained power. Keep staying as informed as you can.
Did you have a TV already by that time? We were late getting one and we kids had to go across the street to our neighbors' house to see I Love Lucy every week (I think it was Monday nights).

Personally, I've had far more unpleasant encounters on Bluesky so far, in my short stay here, than I ever had in three years on Mastodon. Mostly from people who have carried over their Twitter practices to this place.

There are reasons why people choose one platform over another, and I do not feel any need to dump on those who make different choices from mine. People are different and have different needs and preferences.
Bluesky has many more users than Mastodon. That's why the search results are fuller and that's also why you and I are here.

I'm just glad we have Mastodon in the world, for those who want the diversity, flexibility, privacy options, choice of moderation policies etc. that it offers. If it doesn't suit your purpose, so be it. My Vivaldi instance is pretty great, though.
Hey, all this dissing of the Fediverse is going to drive me right back there. 😢

Different instances have different moderation policies, but the main ones are mostly the same in that regard. Finding accounts to follow is easier on Mastodon than on Bluesky in my experience. And the keyword search is also pretty good these days. What instance are (were) you on?

Maybe being an octogenarian makes me more patient. But you don't have to follow accounts to get decent search results. I would say Mastodon today provides a better search functionality than Bluesky. As for Famichiki, that's only a tiny part of Mastodon. I agree there are jerks there, but here too.

What environment? I use the PC site with the advanced interface and can find and follow all kinds of accounts easily, including those on Threads and Bluesky that have federated. Another way to find things is to browse the Federated stream.

My Mastodon profile has these data:
1.2K Followers  3.2K Following  4.3K Posts
So my experience may differ from those who dipped their toe in and didn't find what they like. Also, the search function is much improved. And Famichiki, while not my instance (I'm on Vivaldi's server), is full of energy.
The last thing I need is more options 😉
What surprises me is how few good posts there are compared to Bluesky, even though Threads supposedly has four times as many users.
So one of the other parties should introduce such legislation. It very likely would pass.
I see they are being posted on Bluesky as well.
Were you able to register right away because you were a user of the original Mixi? I wonder how long it will be invitation-only.

I think there might be a market for it here. My sons used the original Mixi to keep up with their friends, but have no interest in FB or Instagram, etc. One question is whether they or their friends get invitations so they can resume connecting.
*Pricey* aged sake

We used to live in a house with a yuzu tree right outside the livingroom. I did a lot of experimentation with yuzu cocktails back then. And of course my wife used them in sauces, like homemade ponzu sauce.
For example, I have a "Local" Xitter list with 93 accounts, none of which are on any other platform. Same with my Japanese Politics list.
That's my problem, too. Following Japanese politics, or local community information, is almost impossible on any platform other than Xitter.
I follow more than 3,200 accounts on Mastodon so it's quite lively. I also follow 4,500 accounts on Bluesky but have fewer followers, especially real ones, than on Mastodon.
Yes, I have not completely ruled out just dumping them all.

There are actually four candidates: Xitter, Mastodon, Bluesky, and Threads. It's hard to see me choosing Threads, but Mastodon is still a strong contender and lets me follow accounts on Bluesky and Threads that choose to federate. The main advantage of X is so many of my Japanese friends use it.
Yes, that looks very nice indeed!
Really? I grew up there but haven't been back since the early 1990s. Things must have changed in the meantime.
Why? She's a city person and so am I. We are happy to live where everything is within walking distance, with no need for a car. We like the community feeling in each Tokyo neighborhood.
My wife would never again live in the white part after experiencing it for less than a year in her youth.
The TBS wide show MC watching it live couldn't read it either.
I appreciate your optimism, in any case.
When I was in high school, only classical music came on albums. (It was before the Beatles.)
Open Settings --> Moderation --> Blocked accounts. Unblock any account on the list that you want to see.
Depth has since been updated to 10 km, but still shallow

Again, character limit did not allow that. I think someone should thank me for showing the intensity scale equivalents, which was the main point of the post, rather than accusing me falsely of not knowing the difference between magnitude and shaking intensity.
Fortunately it was off shore and quite shallow (0.6km)
Dr. Geller, I rewrote the post to make it clearer what I was trying to say within the character limit. Please see the new version.
That was supposed to mean "Here (the link below) is a page showing the intensity ratings of the recent Cape Mendocino Magnitude 7.0 quake" but we have character limits here.
I know all that of course. I was trying to offer information about converting Worden intesity scale to Shindo. What in my post are you trying to correct??
(Me just noticing your redhero handle and belatedly following)
Tokorozawa was the location. 50 km depth and M3.3

My belief comes from a lifetime of experiencing and watching how each layer of rules and other intervention in play ends up reducing the joy and raising the stress level. Kids play naturally; they are experts at it. As soon as an adult steps in, the magic starts dissipating.
Nobody agrees with my belief that all play should be spontaneous, with no coaches, refs, or any other interference, which would mean the end of all organized sports.
Weathernews.jp is on to it now, too. Saitama just across the border from Tokyo
And thanks for the follow. Hope you find something of interest in the wide variety of topics I post about.
That's a good point. On the other hand, they used to be a really small party and this stumble occurs just as they have been gaining traction (and outsized influence) under Tamaki.

The dependence of smaller parties on the representative for their brand identity (think Reiwa, Sanseito, NHK, Conservative Party) seems especially crucial, which makes this a damaging blow even if he comes crawling back in three months.
As a placeholder, maybe
Gorgeous!
